channel.title: Softmod a Wii?
channel.description: Well, the family got a Wii for Christmas. I personally don't like many of the games that we have for it, but I do want to play Mario Cart without having to buy the game. I've searched how to softmod it to play backup games but almost everything I have found either requires a chip or you have to pay for the softmod... I recall reading a post of where MITB saying he softmodded his. I was wondering if there was a tutorial you could link me to or something. Thanks.

item.title: Softmod a Wii?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Starting up …, post:8, topic:323795”][quote author=sppt link=topic=420198.msg3086708#msg3086708 date=1262554402]
bannerbomb or twilight princess hack should work for you.
[/quote]I’m currently using banner bomb… But I don’t think I can play backup’s of games using it Can I?[/quote]

bannerbomb is just an exploit, youd have to run it each time. what you should be doing is using bannerbomb to install bootmii (http://bootmii.org/install/) and the homebrew channel. then you can just copy games onto a usb flash drive/hard drive and run them from your wii, or probably put them on dvds too.

there are guides to this everywhere

edit: oh yeah you also have to patch the ios to play haxed games. find a full guide.

Read full topic

@Erj wrote:

Hmm I got 1 3.4U too. But I’m pretty sure Wii backups are playable. Just install the usual files for playing it google search for it.

Also, My dad bought it about a week ago. So I would consider it being on the newest version.
